description: Uncertain. Often suggested to derive from hog, either in reference to Hog Island, a site of shipyards that employed Italian immigrants (who were supposedly called hoggies and who supposedly packed these sandwiches for lunch), or in reference to pork as an ingredient.

entries.meaning: (US, Pennsylvania) A sandwich made on a (usually soft) long Italian roll; a submarine sandwich.
examples: I'm going to Wawa to get a hoagie for lunch.
